ARCHIVIST: You -- you stay away from me.

Yes -- Tim, I just I need a second, to.
[disoriented] Yes, yes, if you could, I'd -- I'd value your input on it.
No, no -- I would -- I could have stopped them.
It's not my fault you died.
[despairing] No, not -- not you as well.
why -- why didn't you warn me it would be like this?
Just -- give me a moment, please.
I see the sad clown, bitter and hateful.
I see him finding his way into the circus where nobody knew him.
I see him torn apart, becoming the mask, remade by a cruel ringmaster.
Sometimes a doll, sometimes a mannequin, always hiding in somebody else's skin.
SARAH!NIKOLA: sometimes I think I'm just not built for names.
A hundred puppets, a hundred pointless names.
She killed one of the couriers.
She was also the one that damaged this shell.
Not until you finish the dance.
This in-between is not as comfortable for all of us as it is for you.
TIM!NIKOLA: Yes, that's your name, and I'm Tim, your friend.
[overlapping] Everything is going to be alright.
And how *are* you going to stop it?
I'm sure we can work it out together.
Now let's take a look at this.
Right now, what we have here is our handheld remote detonator.
I imagine if you'd used it, we'd all have come to quite a nasty end.
[giggling] Don't you worry, Archivist, it's all in good hands.
BREEKON: You don't even know what a gun is.
Do you even know what you've done?
Shame you don't know your own coffin.
TIM: *Everyone* is, this isn't -- just get back.
See if you can do it again before I can squeeze.
I don't know if you can hear me, but if you can.
You know I hear the great Grimaldi's in town.
You should go see it, cheer yourself up.
BASIRA: I'm not -- I'm not one of them.
Okay, okay who -- who are you?
We just need to figure this out.
I know -- I know I'm me and I know I'm here.
There's things that -- that they're not me, they want to hurt me, but.
I don't want to hurt you.
I don't want to hurt anyone.
You are you and you're in a place now.
if it's a place, and it's now, then.
and they wanna hurt me so -- so.
You leave the place and the now.
You know how to move, so do it.
Keep moving until you find another place.
NIKOLA: Just because you don't understand doesn't mean it's a lie.
Back from the dead, just like you wanted!
Go on then, try it -- make a fist.
Do you even know which of these hands is yours?
Do you even know what a hand *is?
I already have what I want, little Archivist!
Now I just want you to join me for a dance!
it's almost there, the new day.
And it's far too late for any of that.
Nothing you see can help you.
After all this preparation, all your research!
All this magnificent grotesquery, and what -- you were just going to blow it up?
You have hundreds of shells, Sarah!
And soon you will have tens of thousands.
You can have your little girl within every dark corner of the whole world!
Oh, just let me enjoy myself for a moment!
This is a once in an eternity event after all.
A long time ago, before Orsinov made me.
And sometimes, even now, for special occasions.
That's quite enough from *you*, I think.
Do you really make the world will fare any better under the Watcher?
GERTRUDE!NIKOLA: I would *hope* you do.
Don't be obtuse, John.
I'm here because you failed.
You almost what?
You almost *didn't* doom the world?
No, you *almost* let reality be the plaything of a lazy, foolish liar.
You didn't even know what it was.
Do you know how many people I killed to keep the world in one piece?
The sacrifices I made, and you didn't even know what you were fighting.
I suppose it's of no consequence now, it's far too late.
[gleefully] You can scream, I suppose.
Have you considered curling into a ball?
You know, it's probably for the best I'm dead.
Can you imagine how I'd hate having to watch you fumble around as my replacement?
I really cannot express how much of a disappointment you are.

And now look at me.
You've made me part of their ritual.
This is *your fault*.
A terrible new world.
It is all your fault.
LEITNER!NIKOLA: *that* one is very much your fault.
I hardly had the chance, did I?
Before you left me to get my head bashed in.
I suppose you should have remembered that smoking kills.
Surely you know what a cigarette is.
If our earlier conversation was anything to go by, I hardly think you can blame your faults on the ritual.
Your problems go far deeper than that.
Honestly, if I wasn't so dead I'd be impressed.
I always thought my own hubris to be quite exceptional, but you've managed to somehow deliver more bad decisions into two years than I managed in a lifetime.
But by all means take your moment.
Though I suppose you never really had a chance.
